Data: Bopara to Finch, no run length ball on off stump, sticks in the wicket a little and Finch gets a leading edge trying to pat across the line of the ball
Bopara to Finch, 1 run gets on the front foot and drives one through the covers
Bopara to Watson, no run Watson stays back, dangles his bat out horizontally and is beaten, Buttler taking it up to the stumps
Bopara to Watson, no run length ball, Watson pushes into the off side

Bopara to Watson, no run there's a mix up and England could have had a run-out at both ends! Watson pushed the ball to mid-off and both he and Finch set off before realising there wasn't a run, Root could have thrown it to Buttler at the striker's end, decided to have a shy at the bowler's end and missed, with both batsmen out of their ground
Bopara to Watson, 1 run on a length outside off, sits back and glides a single to third man
Tredwell to Watson, no run tossed up and skids on with the arm outside off, defended
Tredwell to Watson, no run pushed through, Watson comes forward and defends
Tredwell to Watson, no run worked off the front pad to midwicket
Tredwell to Watson, SIX runs bit more air on this and Watson gets to the pitch, clatters a big ole mow over wide long-on, there was a man out there but it clears him into the crowd
Tredwell to Watson, no run turn for Tredwell, this spins back and cramps Watson as he tries to cut
Tredwell to Watson, no run gets in a tangle again, flatter and quicker and Watson is beaten pushing outside off
Bopara to Finch, 2 runs length ball outside off, steered through backward point and wide of third man for a couple
Bopara to Finch, 1 run gets forward and pushes one into a gap in the covers
Bopara to Watson, no run slightly full, around the line of off, pushed back on the front foot

Bopara to Watson, OUT length, outside off, Watson tries to cut off the back foot, he misses - or does he? Bopara is convinced he hit this and England review. We're into Clockwork Orange replay territory, the footage run over and over again from different angles
Bopara to Clarke, no run length ball, wide of the stumps and chopped to point on the back foot
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run width again, drops back and guides one down to third man
Rankin to Clarke, no run slightly back of a length and outside off, turned to leg
Rankin to Clarke, no run comes forward and blocks
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run hops back, the ball seams in and rises off a length, defended behind square on the off side
Rankin to Finch, no run good-length delivery, outside off and coming back, Finch thrusts out a pad and leaveas
Rankin to Finch, no run pitched up a bit further, defended coming forwards
Rankin to Finch, no run full and in the channel, punched into the ground and fielded by Rankin in his follow through
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run little bit of width and Clarke steers cut-dab through point
Bopara to Finch, no run length ball, around off, pushed back on the off side
Bopara to Finch, FOUR runs slightly full, Finch hits out and just clears mid-off, came off the bat near the toe but there was enough on it, the ball runs for four
Bopara to Finch, 1 leg bye works the ball of the pads into the leg side
Bopara to Clarke, no run pitched up on the stumps, Clarke drives, fine of mid-on but there's no run
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run width offered again, stays back and runs another single down to third man
Rankin to Clarke, no run dug in short, the ball rises to a good height on its way through as Clarke drops his hands inside the line
Rankin to Clarke, no run half an appeal from Rankin, as he beats Clarke for pace on the inside, hits the pad ... heading down past leg, though
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run length, on the stumps and worked through square leg from deep in the crease
Rankin to Finch, no run Finch gets forward to a length ball around off
Rankin to Finch, 1 run little bit wide, Finch drives and gets a thick edge through gully/third slip, single down to third man
Rankin to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke deals with this well enough, not really a bouncer from Rankin and it sits up to be pulled smartly through midwicket for four
Bopara to Finch, 1 run on the stumps, nurdled to leg for one more
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run bangs this in short of a length, again Clarke is equal to it, keeping a pull shot down towards deep square leg
Bopara to Finch, 1 run little bit short and width for Finch to cue end one down to third man
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run the bat turns in the hand as Clarke attempts an expansive drive, the ball screws away through square leg
Bopara to Finch, no run comes forward, hitting slightly across the line and the ball pings back to Bopara
Bopara to Finch, no run touch back of a length, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, comes forward and worked with the spin into a gap on the leg side

Tredwell to Finch, no run there's an lbw appeal from Tredwell, think the ball hit pad before bat, but umpire S Ravi isn't interested. No one else was, really, but Morgan decides the go with his bowler and England review. This looks a little speculative, though it was definitely pad first ... the line is the key and Hawk-Eye adjudges the ball st
Tredwell to Finch, 1 run little bit wide and Finch drops back, cuts one through point to the sweeper
Tredwell to Clarke, FOUR runs excellent footwork makes this a drivable delivery for Clarke, who lasers the ball through extra cover and all the way to the rope
Tredwell to Clarke, no run tossed up, spinning in and defended coming forwards
Tredwell to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke is on the walk again, works thew ball into midwicket and they pick up a couple
Bopara to Finch, no run pitched up in the channel, driven with a flourish but straight to mid-off
Bopara to Finch, 1 run length delivery, little bit wider and crunched off the back foot through point, there's a man out there
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run slightly back of a length and the ball jags in, hits Clarke in the midriff, they steal a bye as Stokes runs in from point and misses trying to kick the ball on to the stumps
Bopara to Finch, 1 run pitched up and punched towards mid-off
Bopara to Clarke, no run hit on the pad by a fullish ball that tails in, would have slid past leg
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run goes across and works the ball into the leg side
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, spinning from off to leg and nudge through square for one

Tredwell to Finch, SIX runs gives it some air and Tredwell is again carted for six! Agricultural stuff from Finch but with those forearms you'd happily let him plough your field, he plants his front foot and slog-sweeps flat over midwicket
Tredwell to Finch, no run flatter, pushed back down the track
Tredwell to Finch, 1 run makes a bit of room and drives one through the covers
Tredwell to Clarke, FOUR runs dainty footwork from Clarke, who looks like he's auditioning for a spot on Strictly Come Prancing, flutters down the pitch and lofts Tredwell over mid-off for four
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run gets forward and works the ball back down the ground to long-on
Bopara to Clarke, no run length ball, pushed on the front foot towards mid-off
Bopara to Clarke, no run tight line and Clarke can only work the ball back to the bowler
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run little bit wider, Clarke drops back and glides one down to third man
Bopara to Finch, 1 run waits, dabs the ball short and square on the off side for another single

Bopara to Clarke, no run woof, beaten and the ball flying just over the top of the stumps! Buttler though there might have been an edge but Bopara wasn't so interested, Clarke dropping back and attempting to run the ball off the face, failed to make contact
Bopara to Clarke, no run tapped short into the covers, thinks about stealing a base but quickly turns back
Tredwell to Finch, FOUR runs tossed up around off stump, Finch backs away and cracks the ball flat down the ground, the man at long-on gets there but can't cut it off
Tredwell to Finch, 1 run pushed back past the bowler for long-on
Tredwell to Clarke, FOUR runs flighted, on off stump, Clarke skips forward and hits the ball inside to out, against the spin but cleanly and crisply over extra cover for another boundary
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run comes forward and works the ball down the ground again

Tredwell to Finch, OUT goes for another big slog down the ground but picks out long-on! Finch has given it away, launching the ball flat and straight down the gullet of Joe Root on the fence, who barely has to move and swallows it without fuss
Tredwell to Bailey, no run floated up, comes forward and turns the mid-on
Stokes to Clarke, no run touch short, around off stump, Clarke stays back and defends
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run outside the line of off stump, goes back and dabs one behind square on the off side
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run on the stumps, works across the line and picks up one through midwicket to get off the mark
Stokes to Clarke, no run wide of the stumps, Clarke stays back and steers the ball to point
Stokes to Clarke, no run tight line, opens the face and drops the ball short, point fields
Stokes to Clarke, no run good bouncer from Stokes, zips through at 85mph and Clarke ducks smartly under it
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, Bailey comes forward and pushes one to long-on
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run Tredwell goes round the wicket, Clarke on the move again, closes the face for one through midwicket
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run punches back past the bowler, who can't stop it diving to his right
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run on the stumps, plays with the turn for one in front of square out towards the sweeper
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run good rotation of the strike from these two, Bailey using his feet and clipping another single through midwicket
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run round the wicket, flatter and on leg stump, glanced through square
Stokes to Clarke, no run pitched up on off stump, pushed back and into the ground, fielded on the bounce by Stokes
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs good pace from Stokes, bit of width and the ball is edged through the slips as Clarke throws the hands, no one there, though, and it will fly to the boundary
Stokes to Clarke, no run goes full and straight, Clarke had gambled on that, opened his body and thrashed a drive straight at mid-off
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run waits on a slower ball, drops short of point and calls Bailey through, a direct hit would have made things interesting
Stokes to Bailey, no run stays back and guides a length ball to point
Stokes to Bailey, no run Morgan again swoops in from square of the wicket to prevent Bailey from picking up one
Tredwell to Clarke, no run continues round the wicket, pushed back down the track
Tredwell to Clarke, no run flighted, outside off, leans out and defends with a straight bat
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and nudges one down the ground to long-on
Tredwell to Bailey, SIX runs BOOM goes the dynamite! Bailey on the charge, gets plenty of bat on a lofted shot straight down the ground, goes all the way
Tredwell to Bailey, no run driven back and well fielded by Tredwell
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run tossed up on the stumps and worked through the leg side
Stokes to Bailey, no run tight line and defended around off stump
Stokes to Bailey, no run good nut from Stokes, a little wide but it darts away as Bailey wafts and misses in the channel
Stokes to Bailey, no run done him again, Bailey prodding forward uncertainly outside off, beats the outside edge on its way through to Buttler
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run pitched up and dropped into the covers for a single
Stokes to Clarke, no run Stokes is working up good pace and bounce right now, gets one through past Clarke's leaden-footed swish this time
Stokes to Clarke, no run punched into the covers, another dot - excellent over from Stokes
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run slightly full and tailing in, clipped through midwicket for a single
Bopara to Clarke, no run fullish, wide of the stumps, pushed to the fielder in front of square

Bopara to Clarke, no run takes a bit of pace off of, Clarke a little early on the shot but he manages to check it, the ball dying and bouncing into the stumps at the other end as Bopara threw himself to his right
Bopara to Clarke, no run good length, comes forward and pushes into the covers
Bopara to Clarke, no run tight stuff from Bopara, the batsman comes forward and plays with a straight bat into the covers
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run low full toss, wide of the stumps and pushed to mid-off for a single
Stokes to Clarke, 2 runs slightly full, Clarke throws the hands through an uppish drive, gets under it but the shot has the distance to clear Finn running back from mid-off
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run gets forward, drives hard at the ball and gets an inside edge through square
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs short ball, stops a little on Bailey and his pull lobs in the air but safe through midwicket
Stokes to Bailey, no run gets on the front foot and punches to cover
Stokes to Bailey, no run full of a length outside off, driven into the ground and back to Stokes
Stokes to Bailey, SIX runs touch overpitched and Bailey smites the ball over long-on again, excellent stroke, hitting through the line and clearing the rope
Root to Clarke, no run tossed up and blocked on the front foot
Root to Clarke, no run spinning back in from outside off, Clarke manages to keep it out
Root to Clarke, 2 runs heaves across the line, a lot of bottom hand and picks out a gap towards deep midwicket
Root to Clarke, 1 run flatter, skidding on, Clarke works the ball flat off the pads, decides against a second
Root to Bailey, 1 run on the stumps, darted in, turned short on the leg side
Root to Clarke, FOUR runs flat, on the stumps and swept in the air, safely beyond Finn to the now-unguarded boundary - that's four and it brings up a half-century for Clarke
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs ever-so-slightly full, on middle and off and flicked meatily through midwicket, beats the man on the ring and runs away
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run shortens his length, dabbed short on the off side for one more
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs stays back, Clarke opens the face and guides the ball fine, might have come off the shoulder of the bat but it was well played, beating third man for another boundary
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run length on off stump, drives with the bat away from the front pad, inside-edged through backward square leg
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run short, attempted bouncer and pulled flat through square for one
Stokes to Clarke, no run back of a length, seams back in as Clarke tries to cut, takes the bottom half of the bat and bounces back down the pitch
Root to Bailey, 1 run tossed up, punched back down the ground to long-on
Root to Clarke, 1 run drags this a little short, swivels through a pull to deep midwicket
Root to Bailey, 1 run drifts down the leg side, Bailey had moved across his stumps and sweeps hard, deep backward square keeps them to one
Root to Clarke, 1 run glances firmly off the pads, Morgan throws himself to the ground at midwicket and makes a good stop
Root to Bailey, 1 run stops a little, the ball pops off the bat face and runs down to long-on
Root to Clarke, no run flatter, skids through on to the pad and runs short on the leg side, Buttler gives chase
Tredwell to Bailey, no run round the wicket, tossed up and straightening down the leg side, Bailey misses it, not called wide though
Tredwell to Bailey, no run this loops up off the front pad, Buttler runs forward and takes it but there wasn't any bat or glove involved
Tredwell to Bailey, no run pushed forward on leg stump again, this does take the shoulder of the bat, on to the front pad but plops safely square, Buttler unable to get there
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run works one off the pads to midwicket
Tredwell to Clarke, no run drops back and cuts late from in front of the stumps, picks out point
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run floated up on the stumps, glanced in front of square on the leg side for one more
Finn to Clarke, no run slightly short of a length, comes back at Clarke of the pitch as he tries to cut
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs hit on the up, just an ice cream scoop down the ground, mid-on gives chase but that will be four
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs Finn digs the ball in short, outside off stump and battered between midwicket and mid-on, superb placement on the pull stroke from Clarke and that's another boundary
Finn to Clarke, 1 wide short again, the bumper veering down the leg side as Clarke crouched out of the way
Finn to Clarke, 1 run back of a length outside off, tapped into the ground short of point
Finn to Bailey, no run slightly back of a length, beats Bailey for pace and hits him on the back thigh as he prods from the crease
Finn to Bailey, 1 run length ball around off, gets forward and pushes into the covers, they take on Carberry's arm and get home safely enough
Rankin to Bailey, FOUR runs length ball, poked at from the crease, genuine nick and it runs fine of third man, very unfortunate for the bowler, good delivery, forced and error and still concedes four
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run good length on middle and leg, whipped down to long leg
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run length ball on off stump, dropped from the back foot into the covers and the grab a quick single before backward point can get in
Rankin to Bailey, no run similar line, dabbed too close to extra-cover this time for a single
Rankin to Bailey, no run touch tighter line and played off the back foot towards midwicket
Rankin to Bailey, no run fuller a foot outside off, played forward and plays and misses, good back end of the over
Finn to Clarke, no run excellent yorker-length on off stump, dug out into extra-cover
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs just back of a length and picked up over midwicket, well struck with a straight-arm jab and timed it superbly
Finn to Clarke, 1 run back of a length, 77mph slower ball, Clarke wait for it and cuts without timing, cover saves well and they steal a run
Finn to Bailey, FOUR runs slightly shoirt of a good length and hammered on the pull in front of deep square leg, well struck, four more
Finn to Bailey, no run good length on off stump, dabbed from the crease up on the off side
Finn to Bailey, 1 run fuller length, 78mph cutter, dabbed from the crease towards point, they get a single in front of the fielder
Rankin to Bailey, 2 runs short and pulled high on the bat over mid-on, just enough bat to clear the fielder, rather clothed with a stroke leaning back and trying to heave over the in-field
Rankin to Bailey, no run tries to pull a good length ball outside off and misses, rather too big a swing, position was poor and overbalanced
Rankin to Bailey, no run leans back again and cuts this to backward point from just outside off, straight to the fielder
Rankin to Bailey, no run good length a foot outside off, bit of a nothing stroke really, playing from the crease, fiddles it outside off and misses
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run similar area, dabbed from a foot outside off in front of cover for a sharp single
Rankin to Clarke, no run backs away and tries to clear the off side field who are all up in the circle, Rankin followed him with a good length ball and Clarke missed
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run length on off stump, tucked from the crease to midwicket on the edge of the circle for an easy single
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs poor ball, length on the pads and tickled past short long leg, awful ball to that field
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run short and pulled firmly but straight to Bopara at deep midwicket

Stokes to Bailey, SIX runs gorgeous shot, length on off stump, right in the slot for Bailey to swing through it and he nails it straight over the bowler's head for six, magnificent timing, just cleared the front leg a little to give him room to swing the bat, very nice half-century
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run slower ball, very slower, waited for and pulled to deep midwicket
Stokes to Clarke, no run full length on off stump, Clarke forward dabbing up the wicket and the bowler fields going to his left
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run step across the stumps and playing with the spin through square leg into the deep
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run shimmy down and flick with the spin through square leg again
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs played out through square leg yet again, this softly played off the front foot and they run hard and get back for the second
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run forward, nice length ball, had to adjust and flick off middle and leg to short long leg, they steal a run
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run using his feet again to flick out through the leg side, finds deep midwicket
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run swept off the stumps to the 45, goes too quickly to the fielder for a run
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run good length, tried to be swung over the leg side, gets a toe end through midwicket
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length ball angled in, Clarke was aiming off side, got a thick inside edge to leg, they run hard as the ball runs up towards long-on but just a single
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run slower ball on off stump, pulled through midwicket, just a single again
Bopara to Clarke, no run slower ball well wide of off stump, swung at and missed, probably a wide but not called
Bopara to Clarke, 1 wide this is wide because it's down the leg side, Buttler does well to parry it and save five
Bopara to Clarke, no run tries to step to leg and force through the off side, gets it high on the bat to mid-off

Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs this time clears the off side, little step away to leg to give the space to swing the arms, takes a length ball from off stump and lifts it over Rankin at mid-off, good strike, ruins a decent over

Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs long leg is up in the circle and this is clipped past him for four, Bailey stepped to leg slightly, Stokes followed him, Bailey stepped back inside it and clipped past the short fielder
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs pulled firmly into the deep, they run hard and beat Carberry's throw from deep midwicket, he fumbled slightly and that was crucial
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run full on off stump, swung hard, good connection but only as far as mid-off
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run full, angled in to the pads, pushed up towards long-on
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run slower ball, 68mph, waited for and pulled steadily out to deep square leg for a single
Stokes to Clarke, no run yorker length on middle, dug out into midwicket and the bowler is quickly across to field, funny how yorkers often work

Bopara to Bailey, FOUR runs slower ball. 66mph on off stump, heaved over the leg side, Stokes is out at deep midwicket but it's over the fielder's head but short of the rope, criminal that Stokes is off the rope
Bopara to Bailey, SIX runs just back of a length and nailed over midwicket this time into the crowd
Bopara to Bailey, no run length well wide of off stump, tried to be cut and missed
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run slapped through the off side from off stump straight to extra-cover, they take on the fielder and get home easily, well ran
Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs slower ball, spotted on off stump, chipped gracefully down the ground for a one-bounce four, nicely struck
Bopara to Clarke, no run step to leg, Bopara follows him and the off side stroke comes off an under edge back to the bowler
Stokes to Bailey, no run full ball, angled in, tried to be swung over the leg side and misses, gets hit on the body
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run low full toss on off stump, carved towards cover point who saves but they get a single
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run length ball on the stumps, covered up and tucked through square leg for a single
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run cutter outside off, 76mph, slapped off the bottom of the bat to mid-off, they sprint and get a run
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run length on leg stump, clipped down to long leg
Stokes to Bailey, no run full at the pads, tried to be smashed to Liverpool, Bailey misses and Stokes runs up to save the single as it ran off the pads

Bopara to Clarke, (no ball) FOUR runs oh dear, beamer I think, yep, Clarke backs away and manages it angle it past the wicketkeeper for four, just slipped out from Bopara and nearly took out the batsman and Buttler
Bopara to Clarke, 2 runs slower on off stump, ran down to long-on, the sprint and get back for two and that is a tremendous century from Clarke, his first in ODIs against England, he's been excellent
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length ball on the stumps, pulled around out towards deep square leg, they fielder does well to save two

Bopara to Bailey, OUT length ball on leg stump, Bailey swirls and pulls and picks out Tredwell at short long leg. Unlucky for Bailey really, he helped it on its way down the leg side, tried to keep it down but slapped it directly to Tredwell who held a solid chance with two hands at knee height, a gift for England and ends a fine innings
Bopara to Voges, 1 run full just outside off, ran wide of mid-off and they get a quick single
Bopara to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, guided to point
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run this time Clarke picks out Tredwell at short long leg but safely on the bounce flicking around the corner
Stokes to Clarke, no run nice length delivery just outside off, it holds it line a little and beats Clarke as he tries to run it down fine
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run slower ball, 76mph, length on off stump, clothed down the ground and just a single to long-on
Stokes to Voges, 1 run length just outside off, dabbed down towards third man
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run backs away, Stokes follows him on a full length and Clarke can only play up to mid-off for a single
Stokes to Voges, 1 run full just outside off, played from the crease and angled down to third man
Stokes to Clarke, no run full on off stump, tried to be swung down the ground, find mid-off, full and straight, it ain't too hard
Finn to Voges, no run full length on the stumps, played forward and blocked up the wicket
Finn to Voges, no run full length on off stump, dabbed towards point, Bopara in quickly to save the single
Finn to Voges, 2 runs just back in length, pulled through midwicket and they get a couple in front of deep square leg
Finn to Voges, 2 runs similar line, wide of off stump, chopped wide of third man and they nearly get back for three on a fumble
Finn to Voges, no run short ball on off stump, Voges lets it go by
Finn to Voges, 1 run slower ball on the stumps, pulled out to deep square and a nice cheap over from Finn
Rankin to Voges, 1 run length on the stumps, flicked down to long leg and Voges manages to get away from the strike early this over

Rankin to Clarke, OUT swing to a length ball just outside off, thin nick and taken by Buttler. Those seven balls that Voges faced forced Clarke into a quite wild swing from a poor base and he's got a thin edge behind bringing to an end a marvellous innings

Rankin to Wade, OUT length ball on off stump, Wade plays a nothing stroke really from the crease trying to run it down towards third man, the delivery was too close for the stroke and he's dragged it on. Beaten for a pace a little and got a thick inside edge into off stump
Rankin to Faulkner, no run good delivery, full on off stump, carefully blocked up on the off side, finds cover
Rankin to Faulkner, no run full length wide of off stump, tried to be swung through the off side and misses
Rankin to Faulkner, 1 run yorker-length outside off, angled out through cover, fine over from Rankin, just what England needed
Finn to Faulkner, 1 run length on the stumps, angled down to third man backing away to leg and they get a single
Finn to Voges, 1 run full on off stump, driven down the ground, mid-on makes a good save sliding to his left
Finn to Faulkner, FOUR runs just back of a length, clears the front leg and swings it over the leg side, good strike wide of midwicket, length ball punished again, when will they learn

Finn to Faulkner, 1 run another ball just back in length, Faulkner did too much on the crease and ended up leg side of it and had to angle it down to third man, had he stood still he could have aimed another leg side swipe at it

Finn to Voges, 2 runs full, wahey, on the stumps, dabbed into midwicket and they get two wide of long-on but had they set a proper field for full bowling there would surely have been a midwicket saving one
Finn to Voges, 1 run length on the stumps, slapped to point and they get a single
Rankin to Voges, 1 run yorker length on leg stump, clipped through square leg and just a single as the deep fielder does very well
Rankin to Faulkner, 1 run full at leg stump, a leg side swipe gets just a single to deep midwicket
Rankin to Voges, 1 run another good full ball at the stumps and again just a single to deep midwicket, get a man up
Rankin to Faulkner, no run step to leg, Rankin followed him with another full delivery, comes off the pad as Faulkner tried to swing to leg, Rankin saves the run
Rankin to Faulkner, SIX runs full at the stumps, gets the length just slightly wrong and Faulkner is back in his crease to smash it over long-off, huge strike
Rankin to Faulkner, FOUR runs goes again for a one-bounce four between the two deep straight fielders
Finn to Voges, 1 run full and follows the batsman who had cleared the off side, squirts it out through midwicket

Finn to Faulkner, OUT steps to leg and tries to clear the off side but gets it slightly high on the bat and finds extra-cover where Morgan takes a good low catch down by his bootlaces. Finn followed the batsman and slightly cramped him for room
Finn to Johnson, FOUR runs full on the stumps, Johnson step to leg and swings hard through the off side, connects well and steers it past cover point
Finn to Johnson, 2 runs slower, 77mph, on leg stump, flicked behind square and gets it wide of long leg for two
Finn to Johnson, no run another slower ball, 78mph, just outside off, a big swing and a miss for strike one, batsman totally deceived
Finn to Johnson, 1 bye slower again, another swing and a miss, they run to the keeper and get home for the bye

1.55pm, lunch Well having been sent in, that is a superb effort from Australia, riding on Michael Clarke's first ODI century against England and a fine innings from George Bailey to rack up a imposing total. England will need their highest successful ODI chase to win the match and we'll see if they can manage it in around half an hour...
Welcome back, England have a very stiff task ahead of them and have a new opening pair in Kevin Pietersen and Michael Carberry. Clint McKay
McKay to Pietersen, no run good length on off stump, Pietersen forward and gets an inside edge into the pads
McKay to Pietersen, no run step down the wicket and watches a full length ball go past off stump
McKay to Pietersen, no run shoulders arms again to a ball wide of off stump
McKay to Pietersen, no run more of a good length, Pietersen is blocking from a good two feet outside off to cover
McKay to Pietersen, no run full length on off stump, firm drive to mid-off
McKay to Pietersen, no run forward and pushing a length ball towards point
Johnson to Carberry, no run full length wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, no run good length a foot wide of off stump, Carberry plays inside the line
Johnson to Carberry, no run slightly tighter line, good pace, 92mph, well left a few inches outside off
Johnson to Carberry, no run cry for caught behind here as Carberry leaves again, they're asking for a brush of the glove but nothing given
Johnson to Carberry, no run full length, swings away and flies through at head height to Wade, Carberry played and missed just outside off, very well bowled
Johnson to Carberry, no run push forward and finds point just outside off stump
McKay to Pietersen, no run step down the wicket and tries to fiddle a length ball to leg, shaped back in a little that did
McKay to Pietersen, no run forward and pushed from off stump to mid-off, straight to the fielder
McKay to Pietersen, 1 run finally England are away, ironic cheers greet a tuck through square leg from a length ball on middle and off
McKay to Carberry, no run blocked in the crease around off stump, dabbed towards point
McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs length ball just outside off, punched through point and nicely timed, it runs away quickly to the fence
McKay to Carberry, no run length ball angled across Carberry, who played inside it
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 wide slip and a short midwicket to Pietersen, length down leg
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full wide of off stump, driven but not timed to mid-off
Johnson to Pietersen, no run length ball a foot wide of off stump, dabbed into the covers, too close to the fielder though
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 wide short extra cover now but leg side again, Wade went up in a stupid appeal for caught behind
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run full on off stump, Pietersen is forward and dabbing just wide of mid-on so they steal a single
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length a foot wide of off stump, pushed firmly to backward point

Johnson to Carberry, OUT back of a length a foot and a half wide of off stump, cut hard but cut straight to backward point for the simplest of chances. Right shot but poor execution, struck it well enough but slapped it at shouldered height straight to Clarke who didn't have to move to take the catch
Johnson to Trott, 1 wide leg slip in straight away, bowled for the tuck to leg slip but got it too far down leg

Johnson to Trott, OUT got him! Super delivery, back of a length, it bounced a little on Trott right on line and he nicked it through to Wade a cracking delivery from Johnson. An absolute beauty angled across Trott, it bounced on him, he couldn't get the bat out of the way and got a thick edge for a simple chance to Wade's right
McKay to Pietersen, no run length ball two feet wide of off stump, left alone
McKay to Pietersen, no run nicely bowled, Pietersen forward and played at it, got beaten, should have been left
McKay to Pietersen, 1 run full much tighter to off stump, ran just wide of mid-off for a quick single
McKay to Root, no run full and wide of off stump, ignored
McKay to Root, no run length ball on off stump, dabbed hanging back into the covers
McKay to Root, no run length ball wide enough of off stump to leave alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run length ball wide of off stump, Pietersen throws the hands at it and gets an under edge towards cover
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full a foot wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run good length ball a few inches outside off, Pietersen plays from the crease and gets an inside get into the front pad which runs up the wicket
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run full just outside off, driven firmly to the left of mid-off so they try a quick single and get home comfortably
Johnson to Root, no run forcing stroke off the back foot to a ball sliding across him, misses
Johnson to Root, no run full delivery just outside off, dabbed into the covers
McKay to Pietersen, no run full on off stump, Pietersen tries to flick to leg but mistimes it and finds midwicket
McKay to Pietersen, 3 runs gets this flick away, beats midwicket and there's a long chase for mid-on back to the long-on fence
McKay to Root, no run full delivery on off stump, played forward and blocked into the covers
McKay to Root, no run full on off stump, Root forward and tucking to midwicket
McKay to Root, no run length ball wide of off stump, Root goes back and aims a fierce slash at it and misses
McKay to Root, no run full on off stump, a firm nudge up to mid-off for another dot
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full just outside off, it was driveable, Pietersen flung the arms at it and got a thick inside edge to midwicket
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full on the stumps, flicked up to mid-on, didn't really time it, Pietersen hasn't got the pace of Johnson on this deck worked out yet
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs full and wide, Pietersen reaches a long way out to it and makes a decent connection past point, slightly off the toe but gets four
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run length on the stumps, dabbed into midwicket, Finch roars in from square leg to try and run Pietersen out but he fumbles
Johnson to Root, no run full and wide enough to cover drive, Root gets it low on the bat and finds the fielder

Johnson to Root, 1 run short down the leg side, Root goes to hook it and gets a tickle on it, Wade diving to his left and the chance is dropped and a chance that should have been taken. Wade wasn't diving too far across, got there comfortably with the left hand but it bounced out, pretty regulation chance really
McKay to Root, 1 run forward press just outside off through gully who lets it slip under his legs, poor from Finch, and they get a run to third man
McKay to Pietersen, FOUR runs full ball on off stump, bit of a swipe across the line, good enough strike and finds the gap wide of mid-on
McKay to Pietersen, no run back in the crease and clears the front leg aiming over the leg side but a change of plan, just blocking a length ball on off stump
McKay to Pietersen, no run forward on off stump pushing up towards extra-cover
McKay to Pietersen, SIX runs length on off stump, this time when Pietersen clears the front leg he unleashes a big on-drive and nails it into the crowd, lovely flowing stroke and got plenty of it
McKay to Pietersen, 1 run straighter line and worked out through midwicket

Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs tries to force off the back foot through cover and gets a thick inside edge past the off stump, so narrowly past off stump, and past the keeper to fine leg, a perfect Chinese cut
Johnson to Pietersen, no run touch fuller, angled towards cover point from just outside off
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full delivery with a bit of shape into Pietersen, he defends in the crease having initially looked to drive it straight
Johnson to Pietersen, no run pulls a length ball that's too full to pull, it comes off the thigh guard into the hands of Watson at slip, Wade's appealing again *rolls eyes*
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run a dab from the crease up towards mid-on and they sprint a very sharp single
Johnson to Root, 1 run a foot outside off on a decent length, Root angles it down to third man
Faulkner to Root, no run full on middle and off, flicked into midwicket

Faulkner to Root, OUT good length ball and straight through Root onto middle stump. It shaped back a little and Root was playing with half a bat trying to run it down to third man, poor stroke to a ball which deserved more respect. He came forward and thought it was going to slide across him but a little bit of seam movement has done for him
Faulkner to Morgan, no run full and wide of off stump, Morgan drives it to cover
Faulkner to Morgan, no run straight just back of a length, blocked in the crease
Faulkner to Morgan, no run a foot outside off trying to angle into the covers, too close for the stroke and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good delivery slides past the outside edge playing away from his body a little
Voges to Pietersen, no run forward on off stump, Pietersen gets a thick inside edge into his pad, nearly missed it all together
Voges to Pietersen, no run stride down the wicket and defends with bat and pad together
Voges to Pietersen, no run goes to sweep off the stumps, optimistic lbw cry from Voges as Pietersen misses and gets hit very high on the pad
Voges to Pietersen, 1 run comes down and drives this to long-on
Voges to Morgan, no run length ball a foot wide of off stump, goes to pull but them pulls out of it and dabs it to midwicket
Voges to Morgan, 1 run fuller and flicked wide of midwicket for a single
Faulkner to Morgan, no run forward just outside off having taken a stride out of his ground, blocks towards cover
Faulkner to Morgan, FOUR runs short and wide, poor ball cut to the square fence
Faulkner to Morgan, no run tighter line, blocked from the crease up the wicket
Faulkner to Morgan, no run forward just outside off to block into the covers
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs fuller length on off stump, driven off a thick inside edge that runs wide of deep square leg, they run hard and get two
Faulkner to Morgan, no run tighter off stump line on a decent length, Morgan pats it up the wicket
Voges to Pietersen, no run floated up on off stump, Pietersen down the wicket and leaning out to block into the covers
Voges to Pietersen, 1 run touch flat and allows Pietersen to hang back and dab to cover for a single
Voges to Morgan, 1 run down the wicket and clips down to long-on
Voges to Pietersen, FOUR runs a step down the wicket, gets leg side of a ball tossed up on off stump and drives it powerfully over extra-cover, very nice timing and lifts it over the fielder
Voges to Pietersen, 1 run goes to strike powerfully down the ground but gets an inside edge down to long-on
Voges to Morgan, no run forward just outside off stump and blocks up the wicket
Faulkner to Pietersen, no run length ball on leg stump, blocked firmly towards midwicket
Faulkner to Pietersen, 1 run step down the wicket and tries to clear mid-off, Faulkner drags it down a little, Pietersen forces it towards mid-off and takes a quick single
Faulkner to Morgan, no run blocked coming forward just outside off, pressed up to cover
Faulkner to Morgan, no run forward again just outside off, blocking into the covers
Faulkner to Morgan, no run length ball a foot outside off, Morgan dabs at it and plays and misses
Faulkner to Morgan, no run forward blocking into the covers from off stump
Fawad to Pietersen, 1 run slip is in, floated up on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
Fawad to Morgan, no run back and trying to pull a short-ish ball from outside off, finds midwicket without timing
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run swept from a foot outside off comfortably with the spin to deep square leg
Fawad to Pietersen, SIX runs tossed up on middle stump, Pietersen gets down and sweep hard for a flat six wide of deep midwicket, that flew
Fawad to Pietersen, 1 run back and flicking hard down to long-on
Fawad to Morgan, FOUR runs reverse sweep, excellent shot, taken from off stump on a full length and nailed through point
Faulkner to Pietersen, no run good length on off stump, forward and dabbing into midwicket
Faulkner to Pietersen, 1 run full toss on off stump, driven out only as far as deep cover
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run down the track and finds a length ball to push out to deep cover
Faulkner to Pietersen, FOUR runs full just outside off and Pietersen drives it handsomely over mid-off for a one-bounce four, lovely strike through the line
Faulkner to Pietersen, no run slower ball, 73mph, Pietersen deceived and through a drive at it before the ball arrives, well bowled
Faulkner to Pietersen, no run length on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
Fawad to Morgan, 2 runs floated up outside off, Morgan reverses the hands and swats a couple through point
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run drags his length down a touch, pulled flat through backward square
Fawad to Pietersen, 1 run looped up on leg stump, Pietersen comes out and bunts it on the full to long-on for a single that brings up his fifty
Fawad to Morgan, 2 runs full and swept hard, in regulation fashion through backward point, not cleanly taken on the boundary and they get two
Fawad to Morgan, FOUR runs deftly done by Morgan, getting down early and flicking a length legbreak over his shoulder, runs all the way to the fence
Fawad to Morgan, no run fired in a bit fuller, digs it out towards mid-off and they decide against a run
Watson to Pietersen, no run good length, outside off, walks out and dabs short into the covers

Watson to Pietersen, FOUR runs well, this is extraordinary, a sort of walking ramp scoop shot, using the pace and getting right under it to send the ball high towards fine leg, where there's no man stationed, it plops a few yards in from the rope and then bounces for four
Watson to Pietersen, no run touch short, drops back and pushes into the covers
Watson to Pietersen, no run comes forward and steers square on the off side
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run tight around off stump, dropped into the off side and they pick up one
Watson to Morgan, no run continues over the wicket, angled across the left-hander, Morgan gets behind the line in defence
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run full and angled across Pietersen, who drives on the walk, fine of mid-off and they hustle a single
Johnson to Morgan, no run length ball outside the line of off, defended
Johnson to Morgan, no run slings in a full-bunger, drifting towards leg stump and Morgan jams his bat down, digs it out to midwicket
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run Johnson changes the angle and goes round the wicket, short-length delivery and Morgan pats it away behind square from in front of his nose

Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run short-arm jab over the infield from KP, sitting back and chipping the ball out towards deep midwicket, game off the bottom of the bat, I think, and bounced well short of Faulkner
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run short again, pulled through the air towards deep square leg, again drops short - another single
Watson to Morgan, 1 run stays back and nudges one into a gap at midwicket
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run good length, tailing in a little at Pietersen, who jabs down on it and squeezes one into the leg side
Watson to Morgan, 1 run angled across on a length, opens the face and runs one to third man
Watson to Pietersen, no run goes back and across and drops the ball towards point
Watson to Pietersen, no run very full on off stump, punched into the covers but straight to the fielder
Watson to Pietersen, 2 runs slightly overpitched on leg stump, whipped wristily through backward square, they come back for a second
Johnson to Morgan, no run length ball, on the stumps, blocked back down the track
Johnson to Morgan, no run full, around off stump, tapped back down the wicket, Johnson gets a hand on it in his follow through and mid-on cleans up
Johnson to Morgan, no run goes back round the wicket, pitched up outside off, check-driven towards mid-off
Johnson to Morgan, no run peppery bouncer from Mitch, sails through at around shoulder height as Morgan pulls out of his stroke
Johnson to Morgan, no run back over the wicket, length delivery, opens the face and steers to short third man
Johnson to Morgan, no run very full, drifting towards leg stump, hits Morgan on the boot - the appeal is wasted but the effort wasn't, another maiden from Johnson

Watson to Pietersen, OUT on the attack and he's picked out cover! Watson's golden arm has hit the jackpot, Pietersen departing for a sprightly 60 but England probably needed double that... It was a length ball in the channel, KP drove on the up, didn't come out of the middle - swished slightly across the line, actually - and flew to Faulkner's
Watson to Bopara, no run short and over the stumps, Bopara gets out of the way
Watson to Bopara, no run comes forward and shows a length ball a solid defensive stroke
Watson to Bopara, no run this lifts nastily off just short of a length, Bopara drops the kitbag out of the way just in time
Watson to Bopara, no run tight line, comes forward and shows it the face in defence
Watson to Bopara, no run angled in, little bit of nibble off a length, blocked into the covers coming forward
Voges to Morgan, 1 run round the wicket, on leg stump, nurdled into the leg side for one - first run for 13 deliveries
Voges to Bopara, 1 run tossed up, advances and drives one down the ground to long-off, Bopara up and running
Voges to Morgan, 1 wide drags this down the leg side, Morgan takes the extra
Voges to Morgan, 3 runs length ball, straightening outside leg stump and fiddled past Wade, very fine and they pick up three

Voges to Bopara, OUT pushed back by Bopara, taken in his follow through by Voges and he's convinced this is caught and bowled... If so, it's a very soft dismissal. The umpires decide to check it, Bopara was just tapping down the ground, stopped in the shot and it came off the toe, Voges eased Morgan aside to take the catch and that will be out.
Voges to Buttler, no run floated up outside off, watches the ball through to the keeper
Voges to Buttler, no run full and gripping just a touch, Buttler leans into a drive to cover
Watson to Morgan, no run length ball, played back from the crease
Watson to Morgan, no run skips forward, narrows the gap but Watson stays full of a length and Morgan can't get it away
Watson to Morgan, FOUR runs rolls the fingers over a slower ball, sits up from back of a length and hoicked over backward square leg for a much-needed boundary
Watson to Morgan, 1 run waits on a length ball outside off, drops it short and they scamper one as Bailey hurries in from cover and underarms past the stumps
Watson to Buttler, 1 run works a single off the pads through square
Watson to Morgan, 1 run drops back and glides a length ball down to third man from outside off
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run length ball, spinning back from outside off, worked with the turn to square leg
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run tossed up, Buttler pushes one into the covers from the crease
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run length ball, spinning in and worked to leg again
Fawad to Buttler, no run full and flighted, around off stump, Buttler leans out to defend
Fawad to Buttler, no run little bit shorter, rocks back and chops the ball into the covers, straight to a fielder
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run tossed up, opens the shoulders and squirts one through point
Voges to Buttler, 1 run gets forward and punches a single to long-off
Voges to Morgan, no run flat and angled across outside off, Morgan swipes and misses
Voges to Morgan, 1 wide down the leg side - another wide
Voges to Morgan, 1 run sits back and skids a length ball to short third man, Buttler was quick to call it through and they get one
Voges to Buttler, FOUR runs length, forced through midwicket and there's plenty of muscle behind that, it beats the sweeper running round from square to go for four
Voges to Buttler, 1 run leans out, not much foot movement and hits uppishly down the ground to long-off
Voges to Morgan, 1 run pushed back down the ground
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run Fawad drops a little short, Morgan crouches into a pull shot through square leg
Fawad to Buttler, no run gets forward and drives into the covers
Fawad to Buttler, no run floated up outside off, reverses the hands and swings hard, misses
Fawad to Buttler, 2 runs opens the shoulders and goes hard at the ball again, slices away off the outer half of the bat and just past the diving Clint McKay at backward point
Fawad to Buttler, no run outside off, not much turn and tapped back
Fawad to Buttler, no run pushes this one through a bit quicker, has to drop the bat smartly to punch into the covers
Voges to Morgan, 1 run on leg stump, nudged through backward square
Voges to Buttler, 2 runs forced off the back foot and it bursts through Voges hands, a tough chance but has to go down as a dropped catch
Voges to Buttler, no run tossed up, leans out and knocks into the off side
Voges to Buttler, no run flat and on off stump, defended
Voges to Buttler, 1 run tight line, gets forward and pushes a single towards mid-off
Voges to Morgan, no run Morgan tries to reverse sweep from outside leg stump, gets hit on the arm and pad, Voges and Wade appeal, a little optimistically
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run plays a delicate paddle-sweep towards fine leg for one
Fawad to Morgan, no run tossed up on leg stump, Morgan sweeps and the ball hits the toe of the bat and loops back towards Fawad, but short
Fawad to Morgan, no run turned off the pads
Fawad to Morgan, 2 runs slog-sweep, gets under it but there's not quite the distance, it lands between two men at deep square leg, Morgan can breathe again
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run waits on a legbreak and turns one to leg
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run opens the stance and steers another single through square
Voges to Buttler, no run length ball, straightening outside off, chopped to point from the crease
Voges to Buttler, 1 run comes forward and strokes the ball into a gap on the off side

Voges to Morgan, no run darted in, pitching on leg and skidding on as Morgan sweeps, Voges appeals for lbw and umpire Ravi gives it - but Morgan reviews and shakes his head in the same instant. He seemed absolutely certain and Hot Spot quickly picks up a faint bottom edge. Might have pitched outside leg too but we'll never know
Voges to Morgan, no run hops back and cuts, can't get it through
Voges to Morgan, 1 wide very leg side, dross from Voges
Voges to Morgan, 2 runs on the legs, nurdles into a gap at midwicket, the fielder has to come in from the deep and they get two
Voges to Morgan, no run works the ball off the pads again, Voges fields to his left
Fawad to Buttler, no run Buttler reverses the hands and tries to swat a length ball outside off that sits up, he misses and isn't far from demolishing his stumps in the follow through
Fawad to Buttler, 2 runs dabs one to square on the leg side and they run hard for two
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run tossed up outside off, waits and steers wide of McKay at backward point for one
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run floated up on the stumps, closes the face to leg
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run comes forward and bumps the ball into the ground down to long-off
Fawad to Morgan, 1 run length ball, straightening on the stumps, tapped into the leg side - that's fifty for Morgan, certifiably back in form after a wee trough over the last year
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run length ball, out the back of the hand, Morgan gets forward outside off and takes one into the off side
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run waits on another slower ball and taps it square
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run line and length in the channel, leans on a push towards point
Faulkner to Buttler, no run pitched up on off stump, Buttler gets his bat down in time to keep it out
Faulkner to Buttler, 2 runs another loopy slower ball, bounces up like a legbreak and Buttler tucks it square, the bat turning in the hands, into a gap for two
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run goes across and works another single into the leg side
McKay to Buttler, no run length ball well outside off but Buttler can only dab it to point, McKay's loosener goes unpunished
McKay to Buttler, 1 run driven firmly from just outside off stump, can't get it past mid-off though
McKay to Morgan, 2 runs short outside off, slapped wide of long-on but not wide enough as the fielder is able to save four

McKay to Morgan, OUT full outside off, tried to be swung over the leg side but it comes off a swirling outside edge that presents a chance to cover running back and Clarke clings on reaching over his shoulder. A total miscue from Morgan and England's task just got a little stiffer. He was aiming one of those whippy flicks over long-on but was t
McKay to Buttler, no run forward and blocked on the stumps up the wicket
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs slower ball, 67mph, on the stumps, spotted and dabbed through midwicket, they run hard and get two
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run off stump on a length, dabbed backward of point and they trot through for a single
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run full on off stump and pushed gently down to long-off
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run full on off stump, Stokes forward and opening the face to run it down to third man
Faulkner to Buttler, 2 runs back of the hand delivery outside off, Buttler slaps it down the ground cross-batted and picks up two as long-on runs to his left
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run full at the leg stump, clipped down to long-on just for a single this time
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run full just outside off stump, driven firmly and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
McKay to Stokes, no run slower ball, 68mph, deceives Stokes aiming a flick to leg, he was through with the stroke way to soon and missed, well bowled
McKay to Stokes, 1 run slow again, 66mph, dabbed from outside off to backward point, they take a single to the edge of the circle
McKay to Buttler, 1 leg bye length ball sliding into the pads, runs off the thigh guard towards midwicket and they take the single
McKay to Stokes, 1 run full on the stumps, clipped down to long on
McKay to Buttler, 1 run another slower ball, pulled from off stump to deep midwicket

McKay to Stokes, OUT yet again slow, 65mph, pulled from outside off, nowhere near enough bat on it, comes off a top edge and flies straight down the throat of deep backward square leg. McKay has bowled several excellent slow deliveries and this has bagged him another wicket. A total miscue from Stokes, miles away from the meat of the bat, it we
Faulkner to Tredwell, 1 run length ball at the body, tucked behind square leg for a single
Faulkner to Buttler, no run back of the hand slower ball around off stump, Buttler steps to leg and slaps it on the bounce to mid-off

Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run, OUT and another, this straight and flicked into midwicket, they sprint back for two but oh dear Tredwell is pretty slow and has been run out that was very laboured, perhaps he wasn't expecting the second run but what seemed an easy two with deep midwicket having to run around the ball to get a return in to the bowler
Faulkner to Buttler, FOUR runs low full outside off, slapped from off stump through the covers, well put away
Faulkner to Buttler, no run another slower ball, clipped to short long leg, they refuse the run
Faulkner to Buttler, no run slower again, length outside off, slapped straight to extra cover
Johnson to Finn, no run short ball outside off that Finn drops his hands on
Johnson to Finn, no run a touch fuller but still getting up to chest height, Finn gets tucked up and wears it on the upper arm

Johnson to Finn, 1 run step to leg and a pretty nasty-looking heave to leg that he doesn't connect with at all, it comes off high on the bat, ends up playing it one-handed, gets it wide of midwicket for a single though
Johnson to Buttler, no run back of a length a foot outside off, flies through and beats Buttler trying to force it away off the back foot, beaten for pace
Johnson to Buttler, FOUR runs full a foot outside off, slapped hard past extra-cover, good connection and drilled away for four
Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs back of a length at the body, turned around the corner and gets two to the left-hand side of long leg

Faulkner to Finn, no run blocked forward on off stump, didn't know too much about where it went, spotted it going towards cover and set off for a single that Buttler wasn't even aware was remotely on the cards, Finn scrambles back into his ground
Faulkner to Finn, no run straight bumper and Finn ducks
Faulkner to Finn, no run full on the stumps, Finn tries to swing it away over the off side and doesn't time it towards mid-on
Faulkner to Finn, no run another short ball, Finn dabs it towards square leg, Faulker fields
Faulkner to Finn, 1 run back of the hand again, wide of off stump, Finn reaches out for it outside off and clumps it down to long-on

Faulkner to Buttler, SIX runs another back of the hand delivery but this one Buttler sees early and whacks it off the stumps over midwicket, a long way back that's gone, great strike and a first ODI fifty for Jos Buttler, an innings he desperately needed
Johnson to Finn, 1 run length ball on the stumps, forward and blocked into the leg side, they sprint a single
Johnson to Buttler, no run steps across the stumps to try and play the paddle over long leg who's up in the circle, misses and thankfully for him the ball misses off stump too

Johnson to Buttler, FOUR runs full wide of off stump, Buttler leans across and just flicks it really but he's so powerful and he nails this wide of deep cover, quite a shot, managed to time it perfectly
Johnson to Buttler, no run now clears the front leg and tries to swing a full ball over the leg side, misses completely
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run short and pulled hard to deep square leg
Johnson to Finn, no run back of a length on a straight line, Finn tries to swing it away over the leg side but misses completely
McKay to Buttler, no run dabbed from the stumps to point, backing away
McKay to Buttler, no run excellent slower ball that Buttler doesn't pick, swings to leg and misses completely
McKay to Buttler, SIX runs he's the power of Buttler again, taken from off stump, another slower ball and heaved over long-on, big strike
McKay to Buttler, 1 run tries to go again but just cloths it on the bounce to long-on

McKay to Finn, no run slower ball on the stumps, Finn tries to swing it to leg, then pulls out of the shot and steers it to short long leg, then there's some confusion over a possible single, ends up a dot
McKay to Finn, 1 run forward and dabbing into midwicket for just a single, the man comes quickly off the rope
Johnson to Finn, no run full and Finn aims a swing to the leg side and misses, Johnson followed his move towards square leg so ended up missing leg stump
Johnson to Finn, no run yorker length on off stump, dug out to point
Johnson to Finn, no run 10mph slower outside off stump, Finn pokes at it and misses
Johnson to Finn, 1 run yorker length again on off stump, dug out into the covers and they scramble a single
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run short and carefully pulled out to deep square leg

Johnson to Finn, no run excellent yorker on off stump that Finn digs out up the wicket and that ends an excellent display from Mitchell Johnson, the England fans aren't ridiculing him anymore, superb today, pace, accuracy, aggression
McKay to Buttler, 1 run full on the stumps, slapped down to long-off, Buttler's broken his bat
McKay to Finn, 1 run slower ball on the stumps, Finn watches it carefully, comes forward and dabs it towards square leg, they take a quick single
McKay to Buttler, no run full delivery that Buttler tried to get leg side of and swing away, he got a thick inside edge into his boot that ran up towards the bowler
McKay to Buttler, SIX runs full ball on off stump and Buttler swings merrily through the line and clears long-on, another big thump from Jos
McKay to Buttler, no run straighter line and a touch shorter, tried to be steered away leg side but misses
McKay to Buttler, 1 run slower ball, turned from off stump towards square leg and Buttler will keep the strike with a single
Fawad to Buttler, FOUR runs step across the stumps and swings a flighted ball past mid-on, bit clunky but still got plenty of it

Fawad to Buttler, OUT goes again but this is straight up, Johnson goes back from mid-on a few yards and takes a comfortable catch. He's thumped a few nicely today Buttler but that was a total miscue that went a long way up off a top edge, trying again to swing away a ball floated up on the stumps. Good solid catch from Johnson
Fawad to Finn, no run Finn forward and gets beaten by a beauty that spins past the outside edge, turned nicely
Fawad to Finn, no run touch wider, dabbed from just outside off to cover
Fawad to Finn, SIX runs tossed up on the stumps and Finn gets down to slog sweep and nails it into the crowd, great shot, great timing
Fawad to Finn, FOUR runs now down the wicket, meet this on the full and hammers it over the bowler's head, Ahmed continues to be expensive
McKay to Rankin, 1 run full on off stump, played forward and dabbed into midwicket for a quick single

McKay to Finn, OUT full on the stumps, Finn tries to clear the leg side again but picks out deep midwicket and that'll do nicely for Australia. Finn didn't nail this like his strikes in the previous over and couldn't clear the deep fielder, Adam Voges, who completed a comfortable catch and handed a third wicket to Clint McKay

End of the game and Australia have dominated today, winning by 88 runs and it was a complete performance. They began with racking up a tasty total through Michael Clarke's first ODI hundred against England; Clarke following up his ton at Old Trafford in the Test match. George Bailey also played an excellent innings, looking in superb touch and playing

Australia's bowling effort was probably the more impressive part of the match. They had Mitchell Johnson in great form, bowling with pace and aggression and ripping out two early wickets to handicap England's effort. It was a sign that perhaps Johnson will be ready to return to Test duty come Novemeber. He was backed up exceptionally well by Clint McK

As for England, they made the wrong choice at the toss, failed to cap Australia's surge until the damage had been done and then never got close in the chase. Kevin Pietersen played nicely before a poor stroke ended the big innings that England needed from him. Eoin Morgan threatened to play his own big part but fell trying to push things on in the Pow

So that wraps up this first ODI. David Hopps has described in detail Australia's thumping victory and Dan Brettig is in position to bring us more reaction from Old Trafford later in the evening. The next match in the series is on Wednesday down at Edgbaston, so join us then for a floodlit match starting at 2pm BST but from Monty and I today it's goodb
Australia won by 88 runs
Player of the match is Michael Clarke, AUS
